summary:
I am a researcher in animal sciences turned business analyst and aspiring data scientist, passionate about solving business problems using data-driven methods.

Passionate about data, problem-solver, and a person with a ‘can-do’ mentality. I have experience in academia and industry field, where I have obtained experience in bioinformatics, genetics, agricultural economics, logistics, and data analysis. Also, I have broad experience in working on demanding projects and mentoring students in particular subjects.

Skills:
Programing languages: SQL, Python, R
Data visualization tools: Rstudio, Jupyter Notebook, Looker, Tableau

profile_positions.description:
In my role within the Registry Department, I actively participate in multiple projects, contributing to their success and delivering valuable outcomes. 
Some of my key responsibilities and achievements include:

Registry Upgrade project:

- Leading the legacy data migration by creating SQL scripts to transfer data from the current ProMISe to the new EBMT Registry platform.
- Collaborating with vendors on a weekly basis, ensuring seamless implementation and improvement of registry processes on the new platform.
- Configuring forms on the new EBMT Registry platform, ensuring accurate implementation of questions and dependencies.
- Providing support to the EBMT staff on various tasks related to the project.
- Preparing thorough documentation to ensure seamless knowledge transfer and future reference.

ProMISe EDC:

- Taking charge of all aspects related to the current EDC software tool, managing both frontend and backend processes for a database holding over 700,000 patients.
- Generating ad hoc reports for our members (National registries or centers) and internal EBMT staff, facilitating data-driven decision-making.
- Utilizing SQL programming language to create Virtual Registries (VR) and perform center merge/split operations.
- Providing support and assistance to the Registry and Membership helpdesk, ensuring smooth operations and prompt issue resolution.

EHDEN project:

- Contributing to the EBMT data transformation to OMOP-CMD 5.3 as part of the EHDEN project.
- Conducting semantic and structural mapping of the EBMT vocabulary, ensuring accurate representation and compatibility.
- Preparing documentation for EHDEN project milestones, ensuring transparency and clarity in project deliverables.

Benchmarking project - outcome report:

- Managing data management tasks, including data validation, import, and integration.
- Creating specific reports and actively participating in the review process of the project's manuscript.
profile_positions.title: Clinical Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
- Consolidated logistic data from two systems by using SQL and LookML 
- Worked on QA analysis: processing, analyzing, and troubleshooting data errors in the Redshift Database ensuring high quality of data.
- Handled administration of looks in Looker 
- Documented and reported in QA findings with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence)
- Built a prediction model, whose aim was to predict customer churn at specific times
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst Intern

profile_positions.description:
- Upgrading programming skills in SQL and Python by using different online learning platforms (edX, Coursera, and Udacity)
- Participated in Udacity Challenge where I won and successfully finished a Business Analyst Nanodegree.
         • learned SQL and Python programming languages
         • used Alteryx program for statistic analysis and Tableau for data visualization
         • helped other students

- Private teaching of STEM subjects to students in elementary, secondary schools and at university
- Prepared a student for competitions in biology
profile_positions.title: Full-Time Data Science Student & Freelance

profile_positions.description:
- Finished a master course held in Spanish language which included 9 exams at the University of León (Sep 2012 - Jun 2013).
- Worked in veterinary, parasitology, and molecular labs to obtain phenotypic and genetic information that was used in the genetic analysis by using different computer programs.
- Worked in a molecular genetics lab with a group of Dr. Johaness Buitkamp at Bayerische Landesanstalt für Landwirtschaft institute to determine the genetic variability of two MHC genes (Nov 2013 - Dec 2013).
- Collaboration with a group of prof. Michael Stear at the University of Glasgow to develop a mathematical model to deal with the distribution of the Fecal Egg Counts indicator (Jan 2014 - Feb 2014).
